messageBody:
Sorry. My bad. I've missed additional matchers library for JUnit.

Given the currently available features of Java, I guess less verbose tests are impossible. I just hope when (and if) Java 7 comes out, and if language level support for collections feature is included, less verbose and more attractive syntax could be used for this:

assertThat( store.items, hasItems (
allOf( hasProperty ("name", "Bread"), hasProperty ("price", 15) ),
allOf( hasProperty ("name", "Apple"), hasProperty ("price", 5),
...
));

Maybe something like:

assertThat( store.items, hasItems (
hasProperties( {"name": "Bread", "price": 15} ),
...
));

Michael

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Steve Freeman <smgfreeman@...> wrote:
>
> There are property matchers in Hamcrest. Is that what you wanted?
>
> S.
